titleStmt.title: By the King: a proclamation. James R. Whereas we have by former proclamations of the eighteenth and twenty seventh days of June last, for the reasons therein set forth; ordained and declared that a certain coyn made by our order of a certain mettal mixed of copper and brass, ...
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1685-1688 : James II)
James II, King of England, 1633-1701.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for alderman James Malone bookseller in Skinner-Row, and printer to the King's most excellent Majesty,

notesStmt.note: Title from caption title and opening lines of text.
"Given at our court at Dublin-Castle the 4th day of February 1689.".
Dates are given according to Lady Day dating.
Copper and brass money to be tender for all obligations.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
